pr_title: [BEAM-10063] Create a WontImplementError for skipping features.

timeline.message:
[BEAM-10063] Create a WontImplementError for skipping features that won't be implemented.

It's not a perfect signal, but will still cover a lot of doctests.
(It's also a bit hacky, but the TestRunner doesn't offer very good hooks for
customization here.)

timeline.bodyText: The doctest docs say that exc_msg != None indicates an example is expected to generate an exception matching the description. In practice I guess it really means the example is allowed to throw such an exception?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -242,6 +242,11 @@ def __init__(self, env, use_beam=True, **kwargs):
         **kwargs)
 
   def run(self, test, **kwargs):
+    for example in test.examples:
+      if example.exc_msg is None:
+        # Don't fail doctests that raise this error.
+        example.exc_msg = (
+            'apache_beam.dataframe.frame_base.WontImplementError: ...')

replies.bodyText: Correct, but I only know that from reading the code. (The implementation doesn't have any ability to customize this, e.g. the OutputChecker doesn't get invoked on exceptional case.) I decided depending on this was preferable to copying and modifying the implementation.
replies.author: robertwb

timeline.bodyText: Can you make this message more descriptive?
timeline.author: TheNeuralBit
